name: The Wizard's Querulous Dram
description:
We are wizards! 

We can communicate with one another over great distances from the comfort of our own towers, using crystal balls. 

Today, we will meet and solve the problem of how to unite the two proud nations of Black Mountain and Smallwood.

Each of you has your own loyalties and agenda that you’ll strive to uphold. How you do it is up to you...but there is one hitch. Wizard decorum forbids open disagreement  among wizards. (It’s considered rude to contradict one elders. Unfortunately, since we all do a lot of time magic, it’s impossible to discern who our elders are). 

This makes diplomacy and decision-making awkward at best. Although we can’t disagree verbally, according to wizard etiquette, you can present an alternative or look straight into your crystal ball and take a sip of your beverage. 

The boundaries of exactly what counts as “disagreement” are fluid...

The Wizard's Querulous Dram is a light, silly live action game designed by Lizzie Stark & Jason Morningstar to work well with all remote players, play in about an hour, and be really fun!

Logistics:
  • Participants: 3-6 players
  • Time: 60 minutes
  • Technology: Video chat
  • Materials:  Beverage in a cup for each player (fancy cups encouraged)
What's Included?
  • 10 page PDF
